metadata.feature_description: Configure and manage content approval workflows with multiple states and permissions

steps.actual: Workflow management page opened successfully showing list of existing workflows
New workflow form appeared with name and description fields

steps.action: Enter workflow name and description, click Save
steps.expected: New workflow is created and appears in list
steps.actual: Workflow 'Claude Test Workflow' was created successfully and appeared in the workflow list

steps.action: Expand a workflow to view its states
steps.actual: Workflow states table displayed showing ORDER, STATE, ACTIONS, MOVE columns with existing states (Draft, Published)

steps.expected: New state is added between Draft and Published
steps.actual: Add a State button is available on workflows not in use. Workflows in use have the button disabled to prevent modification

steps.action: Click Edit (E) button on a workflow state
steps.expected: State edit dialog opens with permissions options
steps.actual: Workflow State Edit dialog opened showing State Name field, Reviewers section with role permissions table, and notification options

steps.expected: Role permissions table shows roles with Review checkbox
steps.actual: Reviewers table displayed with roles (Administrators, All Users, Content Editors, Registered Users, Content Managers) and Review permission checkboxes. Content Managers had Review permission enabled.

steps.action: Open state edit dialog and modify state name
steps.actual: Changed state name from 'QA Review State Edited' to 'QA Review State Updated'

steps.expected: State name is updated in the workflow
steps.actual: State name was successfully updated and displayed in the workflow states table

steps.action: Click Delete (D) button on a workflow state
steps.actual: Confirmation dialog appeared asking 'Are you sure you want to delete the QA Review State Updated State?'
State was successfully deleted. Workflow now shows only Draft (1) and Published (2) states

steps.expected: States are displayed in sequential order defining transitions
steps.actual: Workflow states displayed with ORDER column showing sequential numbers (1, 2, 3, 4) defining the transition order: Draft -> Review State -> Test State -> Published

steps.action: Observe MOVE column for state reordering
steps.actual: MOVE column header is visible in workflows with multiple middle states. Workflow transitions are defined by the sequential ORDER of states.

steps.action: View workflow list with IN USE and DEFAULT columns
steps.actual: Workflow list shows IN USE column with checkmarks for active workflows (Direct Publish, Content Approval, Test Approval Workflow) and DEFAULT column with radio button to set default workflow

steps.action: Observe workflow actions based on status
steps.actual: Workflows not in use (QA Test Workflow) show Edit and Delete buttons in ACTIONS column, allowing them to be modified or deactivated. 'Test Approval Workflow' has DEFAULT selected.

steps.expected: IN USE column shows which workflows are assigned
steps.actual: Workflows show 'This workflow is currently in use' message with 'View Usage' link for workflows assigned to pages/modules

steps.action: Set default workflow via DEFAULT radio button
steps.expected: Default workflow can be selected for new content
steps.actual: DEFAULT column has radio buttons allowing selection of default workflow. 'Test Approval Workflow' is currently set as default (radio button selected/filled)

steps.expected: Approval chain with multiple states is displayed
steps.actual: Test Approval Workflow shows complete approval chain: Draft (1) -> Review State Edited (2) -> Test <State> & Special Chars (3) -> Published (4). Each middle state has reviewers configured.

steps.action: Verify state permissions for approval flow
steps.expected: Each state has appropriate reviewers configured
steps.actual: State edit dialog confirms reviewers can be configured per state with role-based permissions (Administrators, Content Managers, etc.) and notification options (Notify Author, Notify Admin)

observations: Workflow management is accessed via Settings > Workflow in the admin panel, not via Module Settings > Workflow Settings as originally documented
The MOVE column for state reordering appears in the table header but visible move controls were not displayed in the current view - states may use drag-and-drop or hover-revealed controls
Workflows that are 'in use' have restricted editing - the 'Add a State' button is disabled to prevent modification of active workflows
Default workflows are system workflows (Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval) and cannot be deleted
The DEFAULT radio button allows setting which workflow is used for new pages by default

Code review showed WorkflowStateController manages CRUD operations, WorkflowStateInfo stores state properties including Order, Notify, NotifyAdmin, IsActive, and WorkflowStatePermissionController handles role-based permissions
